columns.text: For this problem, we will solve for the value of the cost that will make the company indifferent between the two choice of systems.

In the new system, an automated clearinghouse fee is given for each transaction. What this means is that for every transaction done using this system, a fixed amount is subtracted/charged to the firm. 

Since we are comparing the two systems, we can equate the value of these systems together to solve for the value of cost that will make the systems equal.

As we can recall, the value of the present system is $\$11,578,732.13$. We can then equate this and the unknown from Step 3 to solve for the Cost.

$$\begin{aligned}
\$11,578,732.13&=\dfrac{\$11,601,936-56.048 \times \text{Cost}}{0.99987}
\end{aligned}$$

To simplify this, we can first multiply both sides by $0.9987$ to get rid of the denominator, then we can isolate the unknown on one side.

$$\begin{aligned}
0.99987 \times \$11,578,732.13&=\$11,601,936-56.048\times \text{Cost}\\[15 pt]
\$11,577,226.89&=\$11,601,936-56.048\times \text{Cost}\\[15 pt]
56.048\times \text{Cost}&=\$11,601,936-\$11,577,226.89\\[15 pt]
\text{Cost}&=\dfrac{\$24,709.11}{56.048}\\[15 pt]
&=\$440.86
\end{aligned}$$

This means that if the cost is $\$440.86$, then the firm will be indifferent in choosing between the old and new system since they have the same value.
